abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about how
            Croatia's vulnerable were better served and protected.
            Croatian authorities partnered with the World Bank to
            overhaul the system so it would help welfare beneficiaries
            achieve the greatest self-reliance, and deliver effective
            services to the neediest. World Bank supported Social
            Welfare Development Project, cared for almost 200 children
            with severe physical disabilities. Through the project,
            people with developmental disabilities coped with routine
            tasks like food shopping, cooking, paying bills, opening a
            bank account. Fourteen social welfare centers were built or
            renovated and equipped with a new computer management
            system. Social workers spent less time on administrative
            work and more with their clients. Croatia is a good example
            of a country where changes have been successfully introduced
            nationwide to benefit the neediest and most vulnerable
            members of society.
